metadata.Title: CVE-2021-24001 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A compromised content process could have performed session history manipulations it should not have been able to due to testing infrastructure that was not restricted to testing-only configurations. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 88.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-24001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
